holidays.name: Celebrate Bisexuality Day
holidays.description: A day to recognize and celebrate the bisexual community, their history, and contributions to LGBTQ+ culture.
holidays.origin: Started in 1999 by three bisexual rights activists to increase visibility and acceptance.
holidays.funFact: The official color of bisexuality is a unique pink, purple, and blue flag designed in 1998.

holidays.name: National Snack Stick Day
holidays.description: A delicious day dedicated to celebrating snack sticks ‚Äî those flavorful, portable meat treats perfect for on-the-go munching.
holidays.origin: Food enthusiasts created this day to honor snack sticks as a convenient and tasty snack option.
holidays.funFact: Snack sticks originated from carnitas-style sausage recipes and became popular in American snack aisles in the 20th century.

holidays.name: Autumnal Equinox / Mabon (Pagan Holiday)
holidays.description: Marking the balance of day and night, Mabon is a pagan festival celebrating the second harvest and giving thanks.
holidays.origin: Rooted in ancient nature-based religions, Mabon honors the changing seasons and bounty of fall.
holidays.funFact: Mabon is named after a Welsh mythological figure, Mabon ap Modron, known as a divine youth.

holidays.name: International Podcast Day
holidays.description: A global day celebrating the incredible world of podcasts ‚Äî from storytelling and education to comedy and investigative journalism.
holidays.origin: Created by podcast enthusiasts in 2014 to raise awareness of podcasts worldwide.
holidays.funFact: There are over 2 million podcasts available worldwide, with new episodes published daily on every imaginable topic.
